p: From Figure 22A,B and Figure 23, it can be seen that even in lean pure binary Al-Si alloys, quench-induced precipitation is separated into high-temperature (HTR) and low-temperature (LTR) reactions. For Al0.26Si, the HTR is detected only after extremely slow cooling at 3 × 10 −5 K/s (seen as a two stage dissolution reaction during reheating in Figure 22C). The UCCR of Al0.72Si was found to be 1 K/s [ 117, 132], while for Al0.26Si this is only 3 × 10 −2 K/s [ 132].
